==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|大|地|震}}

===Etymology 1===
Compound of {{compound|大|tr1=ō|t1=great|地震|tr2=jishin|t2=earthquake|lang=ja}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[oːdʑiɕiɴ]|lang=ja}}

====Noun====
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{ja-noun|おおじしん|hhira=おほぢしん}}

# a large [[earthquake]]; typically has a magnitude 7 or greater
#: [[w:ja:2010年チリ大地震|2010年チリ'''大地震''']]。
#:: 2010ねんチリ'''おおじしん'''。
#:: ''2010-nen Chiri '''ōjishin'''.''
#::: [[w:2010 Chile earthquake|2010 Chile '''earthquake''']].

====Usage notes====
* Both readings [[大地震#Japanese|大地震]] ([[おおじしん#Japanese|おおじしん]], [[ōjishin#Japanese|ōjishin]]) and [[大地震#Japanese|大地震]] ([[だいじしん#Japanese|だいじしん]], [[daijishin#Japanese|daijishin]]) are common. The [[w:NHK|Japan Broadcasting Corporation]] insists on reading it as [[大地震#Japanese|大地震]] ([[おおじしん#Japanese|おおじしん]], [[ōjishin#Japanese|ōjishin]]).

===Etymology 2===
Compound of {{compound|大|tr1=dai|t1=great|地震|tr2=jishin|t2=earthquake|lang=ja}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[daidʑiɕiɴ]|lang=ja}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|だいじしん|hhira=だいぢしん}}

# a large [[earthquake]]; typically has a magnitude 7 or greater

====Usage notes====
* Both readings [[大地震#Japanese|大地震]] ([[おおじしん#Japanese|おおじしん]], [[ōjishin#Japanese|ōjishin]]) and [[大地震#Japanese|大地震]] ([[だいじしん#Japanese|だいじしん]], [[daijishin#Japanese|daijishin]]) are common. The [[w:NHK|Japan Broadcasting Corporation]] insists on reading it as [[大地震#Japanese|大地震]] ([[おおじしん#Japanese|おおじしん]], [[ōjishin#Japanese|ōjishin]]).
